problem_names: lemma weak_supplementation: "PP x y \<Longrightarrow> (\<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x)"

lemma proper_parts_principle:
"(\<exists>z. PP z x) \<Longrightarrow> (\<forall>z. PP z x \<longrightarrow> P z y) \<Longrightarrow> P x y"

theorem proper_part_extensionality:
"(\<exists>z. PP z x \<or> PP z y) \<Longrightarrow> x = y \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>z. PP z x \<longleftrightarrow> PP z y)"
lemma part_overlap_eq: "P x y \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y)"
theorem overlap_extensionality: "x = y \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>z. O z x \<longleftrightarrow> O z y)"
translations: lemma weak_supplementation: "PP x y \<Longrightarrow> (\<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. PP x y \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x
proof -

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. PP x y \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x
assume "PP x y"

proof (state)
this:
  PP x y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. PP x y \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x
hence "\<not> P y x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  PP x y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P y x
by (rule proper_implies_not_part)

proof (state)
this:
  \<not> P y x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. PP x y \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x
thus "\<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<not> P y x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x
by (rule strong_supplementation)

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>z. P z y \<and> \<not> O z x

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
end
text \<open> So minimal mereology is a subtheory of extensional mereology.\footnote{@{cite "casati_parts_1999"} p. 40.} \<close>
sublocale EM \<subseteq> MM

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. MM
proof

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>y x.
       PP y x \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y
fix y x

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>y x.
       PP y x \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y
show "PP y x \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. PP y x \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y
using weak_supplementation

proof (prove)
using this:
  PP ?x ?y \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z ?y \<and> \<not> O z ?x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. PP y x \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y

proof (state)
this:
  PP y x \<Longrightarrow> \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

text \<open> Strong supplementation also entails the proper parts principle.\footnote{See @{cite "simons_parts:_1987"}
pp. 28-9 and @{cite "varzi_parts_1996"} p. 263.} \<close>

theorem proper_part_extensionality:
"(\<exists>z. PP z x \<or> PP z y) \<Longrightarrow> x = y \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>z. PP z x \<longleftrightarrow> PP z y)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):

    (x = y) = (\<forall>z. PP z x = PP z y)
proof -

  \<exists>z. PP z x \<or> PP z y

  \<exists>z. PP z y
  \<forall>z. PP z y \<longrightarrow> P z x

by (rule proper_parts_principle)

this:
  P y x

with `P x y`

  P y x

  P x y
  P y x

goal (1 subgoal):

by (rule part_antisymmetry)

this:
  x = y

using this:
  PP z y

text \<open> It also follows from strong supplementation that parthood is definable in terms of overlap.\footnote{
See @{cite "parsons_many_2014"} p. 4.}  \<close>
lemma part_overlap_eq: "P x y \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P x y = (\<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y)
proof

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. P x y \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
 2. \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y \<Longrightarrow> P x y
assume "P x y"

proof (state)
this:
  P x y

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. P x y \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
 2. \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y \<Longrightarrow> P x y
show "(\<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
proof

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
fix z

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
show "O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
proof

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x \<Longrightarrow> O z y
assume "O z x"

proof (state)
this:
  O z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x \<Longrightarrow> O z y
with `P x y`

proof (chain)
picking this:
  P x y
  O z x
show "O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  P x y
  O z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z y
by (rule overlap_monotonicity)

proof (state)
this:
  O z y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

proof (state)
this:
  O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y \<Longrightarrow> P x y
next

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y \<Longrightarrow> P x y
assume right: "\<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y"

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y \<Longrightarrow> P x y
show "P x y"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P x y
proof (rule ccontr)

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
assume "\<not> P x y"

proof (state)
this:
  \<not> P x y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
hence "\<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<not> P x y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y
by (rule strong_supplementation)

proof (state)
this:
  \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
then

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y
obtain z where z: "P z x \<and> \<not> O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<exists>z. P z x \<and> \<not> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (\<And>z.
        P z x \<and> \<not> O z y \<Longrightarrow>
        thesis) \<Longrightarrow>
    thesis

proof (state)
this:
  P z x \<and> \<not> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
hence "\<not> O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  P z x \<and> \<not> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> O z y

proof (state)
this:
  \<not> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
from right

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
have "O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

proof (state)
this:
  O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
moreover

proof (state)
this:
  O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
from z

proof (chain)
picking this:
  P z x \<and> \<not> O z y
have "P z x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  P z x \<and> \<not> O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. P z x

proof (state)
this:
  P z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
hence "O z x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  P z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x
by (rule part_implies_overlap)

proof (state)
this:
  O z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
  O z x
have "O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y
  O z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z y

proof (state)
this:
  O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<not> P x y \<Longrightarrow> False
with `\<not> O z y`

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<not> O z y
  O z y
show "False"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<not> O z y
  O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. False

proof (state)
this:
  False

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

proof (state)
this:
  P x y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed
text \<open> Which entails the extensionality of overlap. \<close>
theorem overlap_extensionality: "x = y \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>z. O z x \<longleftrightarrow> O z y)"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. (x = y) = (\<forall>z. O z x = O z y)
proof

proof (state)
goal (2 subgoals):
 1. x = y \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>z. O z x = O z y
 2. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
assume "x = y"

proof (state)
this:
  x = y

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. x = y \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>z. O z x = O z y
 2. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
moreover

proof (state)
this:
  x = y

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. x = y \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>z. O z x = O z y
 2. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
have "\<forall>z. O z x \<longleftrightarrow> O z x"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x = O z x
proof

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z. O z x = O z x
fix z

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z. O z x = O z x
show "O z x \<longleftrightarrow> O z x"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x = O z x

proof (state)
this:
  O z x = O z x

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>z. O z x = O z x

goal (2 subgoals):
 1. x = y \<Longrightarrow> \<forall>z. O z x = O z y
 2. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
ultimately

proof (chain)
picking this:
  x = y
  \<forall>z. O z x = O z x
show "\<forall>z. O z x \<longleftrightarrow> O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  x = y
  \<forall>z. O z x = O z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y
by (rule subst)

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>z. O z x = O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
next

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
assume right: "\<forall>z. O z x \<longleftrightarrow> O z y"

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>z. O z x = O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
have "\<forall>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x"

proof (prove)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x
proof

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x
fix z

proof (state)
goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x
from right

proof (chain)
picking this:
  \<forall>z. O z x = O z y
have "O z x \<longleftrightarrow> O z y"

proof (prove)
using this:
  \<forall>z. O z x = O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x = O z y

proof (state)
this:
  O z x = O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<And>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x
thus "O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x"

proof (prove)
using this:
  O z x = O z y

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x

proof (state)
this:
  O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

proof (state)
this:
  \<forall>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
with part_overlap_eq

proof (chain)
picking this:
  P ?x ?y = (\<forall>z. O z ?x \<longrightarrow> O z ?y)
  \<forall>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x
have "P y x"

  \<forall>z. O z y \<longrightarrow> O z x

proof

this:
  O z x = O z y

goal (1 subgoal):

using this:

goal (1 subgoal):
 1. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

this:
  O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

goal:
No subgoals!
qed

this:
  \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

 1. \<forall>z. O z x = O z y \<Longrightarrow> x = y
with part_overlap_eq

proof (chain)
picking this:
  P ?x ?y = (\<forall>z. O z ?x \<longrightarrow> O z ?y)
  \<forall>z. O z x \<longrightarrow> O z y

using `P y x`

using this:
  P x y
  P y x

goal (1 subgoal):

by (rule part_antisymmetry)
